main event: A sighting of a shiny white object in the sky over Buckingham, Iowa on December 19, 1960.
interesting points: The object was initially observed at about 15-50 degrees high in the sky and moved in a southerly direction., The object changed form from a dinner plate size to a ball approximately 20 to 30 feet in diameter., The object developed a tail and appeared as a cluster of 4 or 5 bright white spotlights criss-crossing in a random manner., The sighting lasted for about 3 minutes before the object faded from view., The witness believed the object could not be a known type of aircraft due to its erratic high-speed maneuvers.
sighted object: a shiny white object with lights
witness description: A male, age 35, with a lifelong interest in astronomy and science fiction.
